cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.current_location: about 80 mi (125 km) NNW of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn NE on Friday, accelerate across the southern–central Florida peninsula on Saturday and then move into the Atlantic toward the northwest Bahamas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-west Florida coast (near Naples / Marco Island area)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County Line (includes Port of Palm Beach), Lake Okeechobee, Florida Keys, and west coast south of Longboat Key
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida peninsula, Florida Keys, and east-coast counties up to Volusia/Brevard line
weather_observation.wind: Potential tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph gusts) possible Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible mainly along southwest Florida; negligible for Port of Palm Beach
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 12 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes or waterspouts in outer rainbands; reduced visibility and harbor operations disruptions due to squalls
